generate_cru_geometry_file module¶

generate_cru_geometry_file.generate_cru_geometry_file(ryr, jsr, nsr, tt=None, nz=168, nsr_height=None, nsr_volume=None, nsr_ratio=None, cleft_size=1, jsr_thickness=3, double=True, basename='sarcomere_geometry')[source]¶

Generate a 3D voxel geometry from 2D arrays.

Take RyR, jSR and nSR positions as 2D boolean arrays and produce a 3D voxel geometry that is saved to a h5 file. Each voxel is 12x12x12 microns, and the 2D arrays are expected to have the same resolution.

The height of the nSR columns can be given either as the height, in number of voxels, or as the volume of the nSR, either in absolute value, or as a ratio of total volume

Parameters:
  • ryr – (m, n) boolean array
  • jsr – (m, n) boolean array
  • nsr – (m, n) boolean array
  • nz – int, number of voxels in z-direction [12 nm]
  • nsr_height – height of nsr in voxels, assumes height is max if None
  • nsr_volume – volume of nsr in voxels
  • nsr_ratio – ratio of nsr to total volume
  • cleft_size – int, width of cleft in voxels
  • jsr_thickness – int, jSR thickness in z-iredction in voxels
  • double – boolean, save to h5 with double float precision
  • basename – name of h5 file to save to
generate_cru_geometry_file.ppm_to_arrays(infile, width, jsr_layers, subdivide=3, nsr_width=3.0)[source]¶

Read a ppm and create boolean arrays for ryr, jsr and nsr.

A .ppm is read, assuming a resolution of 36 nm. From these RyR locations, the jSR is created by selecting the area surrounding RyR. The RyR and jSR arrays are then refined to a finer grid. Finally the nSR column locations are selected by surrounding the refined RyR locations

Parameters:
  • infile (str) – name of .ppm file (with or without extension)
  • width (int) – number of voxels in each direction [36 nm]
  • subdivide (int) – number of subpixels to split each pixel into
  • jsr_layers (int) – nr of layers of jSR around RyR
  • nsr_width – size of nSR columns around RyR
generate_cru_geometry_file.ppm_to_geomfile(infile, outfile, pad, save2d_pdf=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Read a ppm file and generate a 2x2x2 um geometry h5 file.
